title: How to Install Laravel Using Laragon

steps.title: Navigate to the Laragon site.
steps.content: Navigate to the Laragon site . This is where you will find and download the installer for Laragon.

steps.title: Press Download Laragon.
steps.content: Press Download Laragon . There will be some numbers afterward the word "Laragon"; don't worry if they are different to what is shown here, just hit that button! You will be taken to a site called Sourceforge and a timer will start before the download starts. If the download does not start after 15 seconds press "direct link" and the download should start.

steps.title: Navigate to wherever you downloaded the file to (most probably "Downloads").
steps.content: Navigate to wherever you downloaded the file to (most probably "Downloads"). Double click the installer you just downloaded to start the installation process.

steps.title: If a dialogue box opens to confirm whether or not you would like to run the application, press Yes.
steps.content: If a dialogue box opens to confirm whether or not you would like to run the application, press Yes .

steps.title: Wait for another dialogue box will open, wanting you to grant administrative rights to the program.
steps.content: Wait for another dialogue box will open, wanting you to grant administrative rights to the program. This is important and is needed for both the installation process and to run Laragon.

steps.title: Press Next.
steps.content: Press Next . Then either leave the installation directory at default or choose a custom one (only recommended for advanced users) and hit Next again. Read the information on this screen, leave the box checked and press Next once more. Read over the settings to confirm and then hit Install .

steps.title: Once the installation is complete hit Finish!
steps.content: Once the installation is complete hit Finish ! Well done, you have successfully installed Laragon!

steps.title: Press the Settings cog and navigate to Services and Ports and check PHP Server.
steps.content: Press the Settings cog and navigate to Services and Ports and check PHP Server . Leave all other setting default and exit the settings window.

steps.title: Go to Menu > Laravel > Create Project > Laravel 5 and give your project a name.
steps.content: Go to Menu > Laravel > Create Project > Laravel 5 and give your project a name.

steps.title: Wait for a terminal window to open up.
steps.content: Wait for a terminal window to open up. An automated installation of Laravel 5 and all of its dependencies should start.

steps.title: Once you are greeted by this screen, exit the command prompt.
steps.content: Once you are greeted by this screen, exit the command prompt.

steps.title: Open a browser window and navigate to your_project_name.dev.
steps.content: Open a browser window and navigate to your_project_name.dev. Well done! If you followed all the above steps correctly, you have just installed Laravel
